TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class BaseValidator : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl, System.Web.UI.IValidator
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit BaseValidator extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl implements class System.Web.UI.IValidator

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides the core implementation for all validation controls derived from this class. As an abstract class, it cannot be instantiated. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator> class inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> base class, and thus has a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property. In the event of an invalid entry, the validator displays the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property. If the property is not set, the validator displays the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.ErrorMessage%2A> property instead; this is the text that is shown in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ValidationSummary> control. This behavior is consistent with Web Forms validators.
Of the ASP.NET mobile controls, those that support validation are the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox> control (its <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property) and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> control (its <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.SelectedIndex%2A> property). Other controls can participate in validation by including a <xref:System.Web.UI.ValidationPropertyAttribute> attribute. For more information, see the [How to: Validate Against a Specific Value for ASP.NET Server Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3db6f7e6-ad52-42cf-a429-c2aaa7d64ed7) documentation.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although you cannot directly construct a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator> class, you can call this constructor from the constructor of an inheriting class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseValidator CreateWebValidator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Virtual method for derived class to create its own aggregated Web validator. The Web validator is for getting and setting of the common properties of Web base validator. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates and returns the corresponding Web Controls validator object. The default implementation of this method in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseValidator> object returns null.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the display behavior of the error message of the validation control. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The display behavior of the error message of the validation control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.Display%2A> property supports only the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidatorDisplay.Dynamic> value.
The .NET Framework Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidatorDisplay> enumeration represents the different display behaviors of the error messages in validation controls.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text that will be used for the error message. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The text that will be used for the error message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used in two ways. First, if there is no value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.Display%2A> property, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.ErrorMessage%2A> property is used in its place. Second, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ValidationSummary> control is used, the summary uses the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.ErrorMessage%2A> property for each validator that represents an invalid control.

Docs.summary: Performs control validation, and then sets the property based on the results of the validation. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.Validate%2A> method causes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.IsValid%2A> property of the control to be set to `true` or `false`, depending on the outcome of the validation test.
